byline.original: By ALJEAN HARMETZ Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: Robert Evans, the 50-year-old movie producer who will face sentencing in New York on Oct. 7 for possession of cocaine, has spent the last week giving Paramount and Disney executives their first look at the rough cut of his $18 million movie, ''Popeye.'' Starring Robin Williams and Shelley Duvall and directed by Robert Altman, ''Popeye'' is a co-production of the two studios and their big Christmas movie. ''If the movie's a success, nobody will care about Bob Evans's arrest,'' one Hollywood executive who asked not be identified said. Then he shrugged. ''If the movie's not a success, probably nobody will care either.''
